inlineContent.text: The remote endpoint to connect to.
A flag indicating if the TLS protocol should be used to secure the communication over the connection.
The TLS protocol parameters to use. If
is
and this parameter is nil then the default TLS parameters will be used.
An optional delegate object that conforms to the
protocol.
A
object. The underlying connection is in the process of being established. You can observe the connection’s
property using KVO to determine when the connection is successfully established or fails due to an error. For information about KVO, see

This method provides a convenient way to create TCP connections from a Network Extension Provider. It is preferred over using the sockets API. For instance, the Tunnel Provider can use this method to create a secure TCP connection with the tunnel server that can be used to tunnel network data.

abstract.text: Create network connections to send and receive data using transport and security protocols.
A bidirectional data connection between a local endpoint and a remote endpoint.
Customize and extend core networking features.
An abstract base class for all NetworkExtension providers.
A network endpoint specified as a Bonjour service name, type, and domain.
An abstract base class, shared by
, that represents the source or destination of a network connection.
A network endpoint specified by DNS name (or IP address) and port.
An object to manage a TCP connection, with or without TLS.
A delegate protocol to customize the TLS authentication done by a connection.
TLS properties for creating a connection.
Type to represent a Boolean value.
A value type whose instances are either `true` or `false`.
